Hello,

For me, there are quite lots of differences... first of all, it's
=
easiest :) Just write a small XML file and u can already simulate the
users=
 using ur applications...
This was my initial goal, I spend 2 minutes writi=
ng this file, no
compilation, i just type "junitscenario" and i can see if =
my
applications have the required scability.

The difference is also in the=
 long time goal. We will sooon develop a
plugin to easily drag and drop ur =
functionnal tests to create the
scenario file.
And then, save data like mem=
ory consumation and excution time to
create nice reports ( and detect long =
methods or memory leak)

Hope it's more clear !

On Wed, 23 Feb 2005 10:07:=
04 -0500, Jason Rogers
<jacaetevha@...> wrote:
>
> St=E9phane TRA=
UMAT wrote:
>
> >
> > Hi
> >
> > We just released a new product under LGPL.=
. maybe it could interest you..
> >
> > Description: JunitScenario is an au=
tomation framework on top of JUnit
> > to perform functional tests and stre=
ssing tests.
> > JUnitScenario is a tool to simulate real life usage of app=
lications.
> > It allows you to describe scenarios that are composed of uni=
t tests
> > calls and simulate several users following those scenarios.
> >=

> > For example, this scenario.xml file defines the cashier scenario:
> >
=
> > <scenario name=3D"cashier" users=3D"20" loops=3D"500">
> >   <task JUni=
tClass=3D"org.mybank.MyFirstTest"
> > JUnitMethod=3D"testCreateAccount" wai=
t=3D"10"/>
> >   <task JUnitClass=3D"org.mybank.MyFirstTest"
> > JUnitMetho=
d=3D"testDipositMoney" wait=3D"10"/>
> >   <task JUnitClass=3D"org.mybank.M=
yFirstTest"
> > JUnitMethod=3D"testWithdrawMoney" wait=3D"50"/>
> > </scena=
rio>
> >
> > The goal is to have a very easy way to use your unit tests to =
test
> > your application scability.
> >
> > This document describes how to=
 setup the example:
> > http://junitscenario.sourceforge.net/?action=3Dexam=
ple
> >
> > Visit JUnitScenario homepage at http://junitscenario.sourceforg=
e.net/
> >
> > This release is just a first shot; we are planning to refact=
or it,
> > develop an eclipse plug-in to easily build scenarios, store test=
s in a
> > database for statistics.
> >
> > --
